Sponsorship

SPONSORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES.

If you are interested in sponsoring SwanseaCon 2018, please take a look at our Sponsorship Prospectus.

PARTICIPANTS

We aim to attract 150+ attendees for SwanseaCon 2018 with our previous event attracting over 170.

50% of attendees at previous events have been from London, with 30% being from Cardiff and surrounding areas. The remaining 20% come from all over the UK as well as further afield.

JOB TITLES REPRESENTED

  • Developer (34%)
    Junior (8%), Developer (16%), Senior (7%), Lead (3%)
  • Tester (18%)
  • Architect (8%)
  • Scrum Master (11%)
  • Product Owner (13%)
  • Business Analyst (12%)
  • Management (4%)

COMPANIES REPRESENTED

Microsoft (Azure), Redgate Software Ltd, Viewpoint Construction Software, CGI, Oracle, Waters Creative, University of Wales Trinity St David, JetStack, CodeClub, Nagra Media, Driver & Vehicle Licensing Agency, IntaPeople, Octo Technology, Equal Experts, Codurance, Swansea University, Barclays, Ordnance Survey, Sorenson Media, DevOpsGuys, Ambientia, IBM, Wikimedia, Caswell Technology Ltd, CPS Group, Inviqa, Agile Snap, Zengenti, Red Giraffes Ltd, Scrum Alliance, Intellectual Property Office, Novoda, Fortium Technologies Ltd, Acorn Recruitment, Software Reflections Ltd, City 81 Ltd, Arolla, Unit4 Business Software, Vizolution, Copper Bay Creative, Learning Connexions, HiTech Laboratories, Equity Red Star, Call Credit Group, Dell Software, Couchbase, Just Giving, BBC, Viator (a TripAdvisor company), Deloitte Digital, Imperial College London, Cucumber Ltd, Agile Alliance, Prowareness, MozaicWorks, Backbase, Kainos, Valtech.

Bold text denotes sponsors/exhibitors at previous events.

CODE OF CONDUCT:

Our conference is dedicated to providing a harassment-free conference experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion (or lack thereof). We do not tolerate harassment of conference participants in any form. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate for any conference venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online media. Conference participants violating these rules may be sanctioned or expelled from the conference without a refund at the discretion of the conference organisers.

Information to follow

David Stokes , Oracle

Dave Stokes is a MySQL Community Manager for Oracle. Previously he was the MySQL Certification Manager for MySQL AB and SUN. He has worked for companies ranging alphabetically from the American Heart Association to Xerox and work ranging from Anti-submarine warfare to web developer. He lives in Texas, is @Stoker, blogs at elephantanddolphin.blogger.com, rides a Honda Goldwing, and wrote his first program in FORTAN on punch cards. And he really wonders how many people really, really read these conference biographies.
